In this session, we will be discussing from the 23rd verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam,
continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti.
Yatha Hrishikesha Khalena Devaki
Kamsena Ruddhati Chiram Shucharpita
Vimochitaham Cha Sahatma Javibho
Tvayaiva Nathena Muhur Vipadganath
The meaning of this verse.
O Hrishikesha, master of the senses and lord of lords,
you have released your mother Devaki who was long imprisoned and distressed by the envious king Kamsa
and me and my children from a series of constant dangers.
